entry.title: Reading(2)--cell-free MIMO
entry.content:
åªè®°å½•äº†ä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯è¿˜æ˜¯postä¸€ä¸‹ã€‚å®ä¹ ç»“æŸè¿˜å¾—æ¥ç€å¼„è¿™ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†å†…å®¹ã€‚

Making Cell-Free Massive MIMO Competitive With MMSE Processing and Centralized Implementation

Cell-free Massive MIMO

The key idea is to let many distributed access points (APs) communicate with all users in the network, possibly by using joint coherent signal processing.

provide the first comprehensive analysis of this technology under different degrees of cooperation among the APs

it is possible to outperform conventional Cellular Massive MIMO and small cell networks
by a wide margin, but only using global or local minimum mean-square error (MMSE) combining

a centralized implementation with optimal MMSE processing not only maximizes the SE but largely reduces the fronthaul signalling compared to the standard distributed approach

MMSE is better than MR, MR performs badly in Cell-free mMIMO

Hermitian Precoding for Distributed MIMO Systems with Individual Channel State Information

entry.summary: Reading â€œLattice Structures of Precoders Maximizing the Minimum Distance in Linear Channelsâ€

entry.content:
ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡æŠ•ç¨¿è·å¾—äº†Reject and Resubmission Allowedçš„ç»“æœï¼Œddlæˆ˜å£«åœ¨æˆªæ­¢æ—¥æœŸæœ€åä¸€å¤©å®Œæˆäº†Response Letterçš„å†™ä½œã€‚å¹´å‰å’Œå¯¼å¸ˆè®¨è®ºçš„è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­å‘ç°æ–‡ç« å…¶å®è¿˜æœ‰å¯ä»¥æå‡çš„åœ°æ–¹ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æ—¶é—´ä¸å¤Ÿäº†ï¼Œå°è¯•ç»™ç¼–è¾‘å‘é‚®ä»¶è¯·æ±‚å»¶æœŸä½†æ˜¯æ²¡æœ‰æ”¶åˆ°å›å¤ï¼Œé‚åªèƒ½åœ¨åˆä¸‰å°±å¼€å§‹æ‰“å¼€ç”µè„‘ç»§ç»­ä¿®æ”¹ï¼Œå ç”¨äº†å¯¼å¸ˆçš„æ˜¥èŠ‚å‡æœŸæœ¬äººå®åœ¨æ˜¯æ„§ç–šä¸‡åˆ†ï¼

Response letter å†™ä½œ

å…³é”®çš„å‡ ç‚¹ï¼š

  • point-to-pointï¼Œæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªé—®é¢˜éƒ½è¦å›ç­”
  • æ²¡é—®åˆ°çš„ä¸ç”¨å¤šè¯´ï¼Œé¿å…æŠŠé—®é¢˜æ‰©å¤§
  • æ€åº¦ç«¯æ­£ï¼Œè¯­æ°”è¯šæ³

Example

Comment 1 The motivation for studying lattice codes is narrowly discussed. Many nested lattice code designs are missing from references.

ï¼ˆå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ä¸åŒçš„å­—ä½“æ¥åŒºåˆ†commentå’Œreplyï¼‰

Reply: Now we realize that the motivation of studying lattice codes was not made clear enough in the previous version.

ï¼ˆæ²¡è§£é‡Šæ¸…æ¥šå¯ä»¥ç”¨â€Now we realizeâ€¦â€ï¼Œå¦‚æœæ˜¯æŒ‡å‡ºé”™è¯¯å¯ä»¥ç”¨â€We regret for the mistakeâ€¦â€ï¼Œå¦‚æœè§‰å¾—revieweræçš„æ„è§æœ‰é—®é¢˜å°±ç”¨â€The reviewer raised a relevant questionâ€ï¼‰

The motivation for this work stems from the recognized benefits of lattice codes in multi-user communication that exploit the notion of physical-layer network coding (PNC) or compute-forward (CF). By adopting lattice-codes at source nodes, the receiver can directly compute integer-combinations of the usersâ€™ messages, leading to an efficient harnessing of the multiuser interference structure [R1].

â€¦

ï¼ˆåšå‡ºè¯¦ç»†çš„è§£é‡Šè¯´æ˜ï¼Œrevieweræåˆ°çš„æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªç‚¹éƒ½è¦å›ç­”ï¼Œä¸€å®šè¦ä¿æŒé€»è¾‘æ€§ï¼ï¼‰

In the revised version, the motivations for studying practical nested lattice codes are further clarified on page 1, quoted below:

ï¼ˆä¿®æ”¹çš„åœ°æ–¹è¦è¿›è¡Œå¼•ç”¨ï¼Œåªå¼•ç”¨ç›¸å…³éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼ï¼‰

â€œIn comparison to off-the-shelf channel codes and widely known digital modulation schemes, â€¦â€

[R1] Bobak Nazer and Michael Gastpar, â€œCompute-and-Forward: Harnessing Interference Through Structured Codesâ€, IEEE Transactions on Information Theory 57, pp. 6463â€“6486, Oct.2011.

ï¼ˆæ–‡ç« ä¸­æ²¡æœ‰çš„æˆ–è€…æ–°åŠ çš„referenceåœ¨è¿™é‡Œå†™æ˜ï¼‰

entry.content:
a little test! ignore me

Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.
